content: the knitmore vanilla sock pattern by jasmin canty socks photographed are knit in oink pigments roy g pig sock yarn photo by jasmin canty gauge 8 sts/13 row per inch materials 100g fingering weight sock yarn 2- 16 us size 1 circular needles gigi s variations are in red jasmin s are in pink where both of us do the same thing the text is in black cast on 56 sts using the long-tail cast on over both circular needles to make sure it s nice and loose and divide them evenly on two circular needles being careful not to twist the stitches switch the placement of the first and last stitches this puts your knitting in the round the tail of your yarn marks the beginning/end of the round knit in a 2x2 rib for 1 ½ 2 then knit in stockinette stitch until the total cuff length equals 7 divide for the heel flap knit across one of the circular needles this will be referred to as needle 2 moving forward now turn it around so the purl side is facing you from here * sl1 p1 * across on ws row on rs row sl 1 st knit across note if you re familiar with lucy neatby s slippurl technique this is a great time to use it if you re not familiar check it out it s awesome work in this manner until the heel flap measures 1 ½ 2 ½ ending with a rs row turn the heel once the heel flap has measures the correct length and you have a few uninterrupted minutes to count starting on the ws 2010 jasmin canty turn 10 stitches are remaining on the left hand needle turn 2 slip 1 knit 3 k2tog k1 turn 10 stitches are remaining on the left hand needle now from here you re going to slip 1 then knit or turn 3 slip 1 purl 4 p2tog p1 turn 8 sts rem on the purl across until you see a gap you re either going to lh needle k2tog or p2tog the stitches with the gap between turn 4 slip 1 knit 5 k2tog k1 turn 8 sts rem on the them then work one more stitch turn your work lh needle rinse repeat when the turning has been completed turn 5 slip 1 purl 6 p2tog p1 turn 6 sts rem on the lh needle in this manner you ll have 16 stitches remaining on turn 6 slip 1 knit 7 k2tog k1 turn 6 sts rem on the the bottom of the heel end with a knit row if you lh needle need a little more guidance on the rest of the heel turn 7 slip 1 purl 8 p2tog p1 turn 4
